doc.repnme: La République Démocratique du Congo perd 192 milliards CDF chaque année à cause d’un mauvais assainissement
doc.abstracts: The Democratic Republic of Congo lost 192 billion CDF each year, which is equivalent to 208 million USD, according to a documentary study made by the Water and Sanitation Program. This sum is equivalent to 3 USD per person per year in the DRC, or 1.6 percent of national GDP. 46 million Congolese are using unhygienic or shared latrines. 6.7 million individuals have no latrines at all and defecate outdoors. The poorest quintile is 27 times more likely to practice open defecation than the richest. The open defecation costs the DRC over $ 32 million per year - yet the elimination of this practice would require the construction and use of less than 1.5 million latrines.
